newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank shares extend gains on software venture.
newsitem.headline: Softbank shares extend gains on software venture.

text.p: Shares in Softbank Corp extended gains on Tuesday morning after news on Monday that it would take the major stake in U.S. software venture TrendMicro, traders said.
As of 0108 GMT, the shares were 200 yen higher at 8,680.
Turnover totalled 53,600 as of 0115 GMT, the largest in the over-the-counter market.
Many participants expect the bullishness towards Softbank shares to have favourable impact on the over-the-counter market overall, which has long been in the doldrums.

On Monday, Softbank announced that it would take a 35 percent stake in the U.S. software venture TrendMicro for 3.5 billion yen. It said payment to TrendMicro, which develops software to protect against computer viruses, would be made by December 27.
"Softbank won attention as traders took the news as a fresh factor," a brokerage dealer said.
The trader added that the share would continue to win market attention if it rose further, since Softbank was considered a benchmark for the over-the-counter market.
